wikipedia_page.main:
Francis Edward Street (16 February 1851 – 4 June 1928) was an English cricketer active in the mid 1870s. Born at Hampstead, Middlesex, Street was a right-handed batsman who made four appearances in first-class cricket.
Street played cricket while attending Uppingham School, before making his first-class debut came for Kent against Derbyshire in 1875, with him making two further appearances in that season against Sussex and Derbyshire. He made a fourth and final first-class appearance in 1877 against Nottinghamshire. Street had little success in his four appearances, scoring just 21 runs, with a high score of 12. He was described in Scores and Biographies as "A promising bat and good field, generally taking long-leg or cover-point."He later moved to Australia, dying there at Armidale, New South Wales on 4 June 1928.
